content: brenna scarf or shawlette materials needed  fingering weight yarn  h 5mm hook  yarn needle this pattern is easily modifiable and may be worked as either a shallow trapezoidal scarf pattern below or as a shawlette notations follow chart it is worked in short row from tip to tip with a bottom border that is part of the row itself rather than needing to be added on afterwards additionally this one-skein project works up very quickly so is perfect for a last-minute gift if you follow my patterns you know that i am a fan of the no turning chain double_crochet tutorial video on youtube therefore every row will start with a double_crochet rather than a turning chain if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or if you simply prefer not to feel free to substitute ch3 for a starting double_crochet remember to turn after every row special stitches shell 2dc ch1 2dc all in the same stitch or chain space shell in shell work a shell into the chain space of the shell from the previous row decrease * yo insert hook in st yo and pull a loop through yo and pull through 2 loops * 2 loops on hook repeat from * to * 3 loops on hook yo and pull through all 3 loops chain 3 row 1 double_crochet in first chain ch1 skip 1 chain shell in last chain row 2 ch2 shell in shell ch1 skip ch1 space from previous row 2dc in double_crochet row 3 double_crochet in first st 2dc in next double_crochet ch1 skip ch1 space from previous row shell in shell row 4 ch2 shell in shell ch1 skip ch1 space from previous row 2dc in first double_crochet double_crochet in ea remaining st to end of row row 5 double_crochet in first 3 dcs 2dc in next double_crochet chain 1 skip ch1 space from previous row shell in shell row 6 ch2 shell in shell ch1 skip ch1 space from previous row 2dc in first double_crochet double_crochet in ea remaining st to end of row repeat row 5-6 in this manner always having your 2dc into the st closest to the shell until you have increased to the desired depth or about 1/3 of the overall length from tip to tip approx 20-22 then to make the scarf repeat row 5-6 without any increases only work 1dc in each st until this section is at least as long as shoulder width or another 1/3 of the overall length then repeat row 5-6 except decrease the sts closest to the shell until the last 2 dcs have been decreased finish off and weave in ends block as gently or as hard as you like place pins in the ch2 areas on the bottom border for more dramatic points or don t if you prefer a more scalloped look see shawlette picture below below is a somewhat
